snippet: Federal researchers found that the number of uninsured declined substantially in the first quarter of this year.
abstract: Federal researchers studying effects of the Affordable Care Act report that number of uninsured Americans fell by about 8 percent to 41 million people in the first quarter of 2014, drop that represents about 3.8 million people.
lead_paragraph: Federal researchers found that the number of uninsured declined substantially in the first quarter of this year.

headline.main: Number of Americans Without Health Insurance Falls, Survey Shows
headline.print_headline: Number of Americans Without Health Insurance Falls, Survey Shows

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
